wikipedia_page.main: Sir William Gillilan Johnson (1808 – 9 April 1886) was an Irish Conservative politician and barrister.He was elected Conservative MP for Belfast at the 1841 general election but unseated in August 1842.He was also Mayor of Belfast City Council in 1849.

response: The facility, which was financed by Sir William Johnson and his wife, Lady Johnson, was designed by W. J. Barre and opened as the Shaftesbury Square Ophthalmic Hospital in January 1868. It was extended in 1927 and, after joining the National Health Service in 1948, it became Shaftesbury Square Hospital in 1969. The building was used by the local drug and substance abuse services before it closed in 2010.
